thread.title: Leicester Mercury published Leicester Tigers score a new sponsor
thread.title_full: Leicester Mercury published Leicester Tigers score a new sponsor

author: Leicester Mercury
title: Leicester Mercury published Leicester Tigers score a new sponsor
text:
Leicester Tigers score a new sponsor By Leicester Mercury | Posted: July 28, 2016 0 COMMENTS SHARES new partnership: Simon Cohen, left, and Ian Mattioli Leicester Tigers score a new sponsor X 
Copy link to paste in your message / 
A wealth management and employee benefits business is strengthening its brand by sponsoring Leicester Tigers. 
Mattioli Woods, based in Grove Park, Enderby, has agreed a three-year deal with the rugby union giants. 
The agreement includes shirt sponsorship on the Tigers' home and away shirts, a dedicated Mattioli Woods stand at the 26,000-strong Welford Road stadium, and corporate hospitality rights. 
Ian Mattioli, chief executive of Mattioli Woods, said: "We are very excited about this new strategic partnership with the Tigers. 
"It is an excellent club and their ambition and family values fit very well with our own. We look forward to this being a linchpin in opening up new markets for us." 
Read more: Mattioli Woods to benefit from Brexit 
Leicester Tigers chief executive Simon Cohen said: "We're delighted to welcome Mattioli Woods to our group of partners. We hope this is the start of a lengthy and successful partnership." 
The Tigers are the most successful rugby club in England, winning the domestic title 10 times and two European Cups. 
They have been the most televised team in the Aviva Premiership over the last two seasons with TV audience figures of over three million for the 2014/15 season.
